intro: Veronica glauca subsp. chaubardii, commonly known as the Chaubard's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, blue to violet flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with a powdery coating, giving them a bluish-gray appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands, rocky areas, and along roadsides.
